ä»¥ä¸‹ä¿‚ç¶²æ°‘å¹«æ‰‹è­¯å˜…è‹±æ–‡ç‰ˆï¼å¤§å®¶è¦å¹«æ‰‹å‚³è¿”å»å¤–åœ‹ï¼å””å¥½æ¯”æ¸¯å…±æ”¿åºœå¾—é€å»å„å¤§å¤–åª’fb/Twitterç•™è¨€

Jacky Chor It goes without saying that the incident of the discovery of explosive in Tsuen Wan district is yet another cliche tactics used by the HKPF. It’s a publicity stunt not targeting our fellow Hong Kongers, which is made obvious when the press conference was all of a sudden conducted by a native English speaker.

What’s curious about the incident is how strongly the HKPF emphasizes that the explosive is TATP and was detonated early at 7am this morning, leaving only charred residue on the wall.

What’s TATPï¼Ÿ

It’s nicknamed mother of Satan, which is the culprit of various terriorist attacks like those in London, Sri Lanka and Paris. It’s frequently associated with extremist terrorist groups by western media. The explosive, being highly versatile, explodes powerfully with the rapid expansion of gases without the process of burning or the production of flames.

200g of TATP is enough to destroy a whole plane. Did you claim you detonated 1kg on the roof without even breaking a window?

By the way, the second detonation happened at the rear staircase.

#I_have_nothing_to_say

What’s curious about the incident is how strongly the HKPF emphasizes that the explosive is TATP and was detonated early at 7am this morning, leaving only charred residue on the wall.

What’s TATPï¼Ÿ

It’s nicknamed mother of Satan, which is the culprit of various terriorist attacks like those in London, Sri Lanka and Paris. It’s frequently associated with extremist terrorist groups by western media. The explosive, being highly versatile, explodes powerfully with the rapid expansion of gases without the process of burning or the production of flames.

200g of TATP is enough to destroy a whole plane. Did you claim you detonated 1kg on the roof without even breaking a window?

By the way, the second detonation happened at the rear staircase.

å””å°å¿ƒcopyå¤šå·¦å€‹åå¤§å®¶å¯ä»¥copyå‘¢å€‹


It goes without saying that the incident of the discovery of explosive in Tsuen Wan district is yet another cliche tactics used by the HKPF. It’s a publicity stunt not targeting our fellow Hong Kongers, which is made obvious when the press conference was all of a sudden conducted by a native English speaker.

What’s curious about the incident is how strongly the HKPF emphasizes that the explosive is TATP and was detonated early at 7am this morning, leaving only charred residue on the wall.

What’s TATPï¼Ÿ

It’s nicknamed mother of Satan, which is the culprit of various terriorist attacks like those in London, Sri Lanka and Paris. It’s frequently associated with extremist terrorist groups by western media. The explosive, being highly versatile, explodes powerfully with the rapid expansion of gases without the process of burning or the production of flames.

200g of TATP is enough to destroy a whole plane. Did you claim you detonated 1kg on the roof without even breaking a window?

By the way, the second detonation happened at the rear staircase.

#hongkong #hk #freehk
